Title: Applied Scientist, NLP
Description:
Are you excited about working at the forefront of applied research in an industry setting? Thomson Reuters Labs in Zug is seeking scientists with a passion for solving problems using state-of-the-art information retrieval, natural language processing and generative AI.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our customers through applied research in informational retrieval and natural language processing. We work closely with product and domain experts to identify compelling solutions at the intersection of user need and technical feasibility.

About The Role

As an Applied Scientist, you will:


Experiment and Develop: You will execute the entire model development lifecycle, from prototype to delivery, while applying best practices for reproducible research and well-managed software delivery.
Collaborate: Working on a collaborative cross-functional team, you will share information, value diverse ideas, and partner effectively with colleagues across the globe.
Deliver: You will be accountable for timely, well-managed deliverables.
Innovate: You will be empowered to try new approaches and learn new technologies. You will implement innovative ideas to solve real-world challenges.
Inspire: You will be a proactive communicator who is excited to share your work. You will be articulate and compelling in describing ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences.



About You

You‚Äôre a fit for the role of Applied Scientist, NLP if your background includes:

Basic Qualifications


PhD in a relevant discipline or Master‚Äôs plus a comparable level of experience.
At least one year industry experience building IR/NLP/ML systems
Solid software engineering skills for prototyping
Outstanding communication and data analysis skills



Preferred Qualifications


5+ years practical experience building IR, ML or NLP systems in academia or industry
Experience designing and implementing solutions with large language models
Relevant publications at ACL, EMNLP, NAACL, NeurIPS, ICLR, SIGIR, KDD, or similar.
Advanced proficiency in Python, Java, or Scala
Experience writing production quality code and contributing to well-managed software delivery.



What's in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:


Hybrid Work Model: We‚Äôve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters caf√© networking.
Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we‚Äôve never talked about with as much pride as we should ‚Äì we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.



DISCLAIMER

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we‚Äôve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world‚Äôs most global news services ‚Äì Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Decarbonising Real Estate - ‚Ç£110k + Shares - Brilliant Climate-Tech Start-Up - Hybrid




One of Europe's most innovative Climate-Tech Start-Ups (Winner of the 2024 Tech of the Year Award) has created groundbreaking technology to move beyond the era of dirty buildings and bring Net Zero Real Estate closer to reality.




We are looking for a tech-passionate & bright Machine Learning Engineer who wants to put their skills towards addressing climate change & making a big difference. A team of some of the brightest minds in Europe, from 9 different countries, we embrace a fantastic culture and truly value hard work.




We are a fast-growing startup with a mission to decarbonise real estate - with backing from world-leading Climate-Tech VC's and Innovation Endeavors (San Francisco ‚Äì fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt).




What you'll do:




Participate in the enhancement of our decision-making models.
Create and design predictive models for constructing signals.
Conceive new methods for extracting and combining publicly accessible data. Guide the product's direction and data partnerships.
Devise innovative solutions to address our customers' issues.
Manage the entire development process: from specifications to production implementation. Work with colleagues on architecture, design, and code reviews.




Who we are seeking:




Highly Self-Motivated: You can efficiently and promptly carry out tasks, demonstrating strong initiative and self-drive.
You Get Things Done: You prioritize speed and flexibility, adept at making swift compromises to maintain momentum, while delivering quality results.
Lateral thinker: You regularly step back to look at the broader picture. Changing the problem is sometimes faster and better than investing two weeks in a fancy ML model.
Analytical and Self-Reflective: You analyze your performance and continuously seek ways to improve.
Compassionate and Humorous: You bring kindness and humor to the team, enhancing both morale and collaboration.




Essential requirements:




MSc in Computer Science, Math, Physics or equivalent.
Broad algorithmic knowledge: dynamic programming, graphs algorithms, data structures, etc.
Broad ML knowledge: convex optimization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, etc. Outstanding programming skills (Python, C++, C).
Ability to contribute individually and in teams.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
Swiss or EU citizenship (unfortunately due to size, we can‚Äôt support non-EU).




Desirable qualifications




2+ years of professional experience in software development or data science.
Broad financial/real estate knowledge.
Experience with cloud products (GCP or AWS).




Benefits:




Significant impact on the product and strategy from the start.
Continuous learning opportunities in a growth-focused culture.
CHF 1k learning and development budget for conferences and certifications.

25 days of paid vacation and flexible parental leave.
Mainly based in our Z√ºrich office, with some remote work and flexible hours available.

HTML:
Machine Learning Engineer - Decarbonising Real Estate - ‚Ç£110k + Shares - Brilliant Climate-Tech Start-Up - Hybrid


One of Europe's most innovative Climate-Tech Start-Ups (Winner of the 2024 Tech of the Year Award) has created groundbreaking technology to move beyond the era of dirty buildings and bring Net Zero Real Estate closer to reality.


We are looking for a tech-passionate & bright Machine Learning Engineer who wants to put their skills towards addressing climate change & making a big difference. A team of some of the brightest minds in Europe, from 9 different countries, we embrace a fantastic culture and truly value hard work.


We are a fast-growing startup with a mission to decarbonise real estate - with backing from world-leading Climate-Tech VC's and Innovation Endeavors (San Francisco ‚Äì fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt).


What you'll do:


  • Participate in the enhancement of our decision-making models.
  • Create and design predictive models for constructing signals.
  • Conceive new methods for extracting and combining publicly accessible data. Guide the product's direction and data partnerships.
  • Devise innovative solutions to address our customers' issues.
  • Manage the entire development process: from specifications to production implementation. Work with colleagues on architecture, design, and code reviews.


Who we are seeking:


  • Highly Self-Motivated: You can efficiently and promptly carry out tasks, demonstrating strong initiative and self-drive.
  • You Get Things Done: You prioritize speed and flexibility, adept at making swift compromises to maintain momentum, while delivering quality results.
  • Lateral thinker: You regularly step back to look at the broader picture. Changing the problem is sometimes faster and better than investing two weeks in a fancy ML model.
  • Analytical and Self-Reflective: You analyze your performance and continuously seek ways to improve.
  • Compassionate and Humorous: You bring kindness and humor to the team, enhancing both morale and collaboration.


Essential requirements:


  • MSc in Computer Science, Math, Physics or equivalent.
  • Broad algorithmic knowledge: dynamic programming, graphs algorithms, data structures, etc.
  • Broad ML knowledge: convex optimization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, etc. Outstanding programming skills (Python, C++, C).
  • Ability to contribute individually and in teams.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.
  • Swiss or EU citizenship (unfortunately due to size, we can‚Äôt support non-EU).


Desirable qualifications


  • 2+ years of professional experience in software development or data science.
  • Broad financial/real estate knowledge.
  • Experience with cloud products (GCP or AWS).


Benefits:


  • Significant impact on the product and strategy from the start.
  • Continuous learning opportunities in a growth-focused culture.
  • CHF 1k learning and development budget for conferences and certifications.
  • 100% coverage of non-occupational accident insurance (UVG).
  • 25 days of paid vacation and flexible parental leave.
  • Mainly based in our Z√ºrich office, with some remote work and flexible hours available.


Venchr is an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation. All applicants will receive consideration for employment based on their talent, skillset and individual merit alone.

Title: Python Developer
Description:
OneAPPS GmbH is a Technology consulting firm based out of Zurich and offices across Europe and USA. We are working on various projects involving diverse, multicultural teams with clients across the US. We are an invaluable partner and our teams have collaborated to support the growth of our clients. With more than 7 locations worldwide we help our clients to deliver their projects smoothly. We look forward to getting to know you and working with you.




Role: R, Python Developer

Location: Zurich, Switzerland




Brief job description

Creating and enhancing R-based applications and tools for financial modelling and analysis.
Performing thorough testing and debugging to ensure optimal performance of developed applications.
Conducting code reviews and provide critical feedback for developments completed by other members of the team.
Proficient with programming in Python and R, especially with optimising code to improve model efficiency.
Risk Domain expertise
Banking and Financial services domain based experience
Use of object-oriented programming and an understanding of its principles.
Knowledgeable of Cloud Computing such as Azure
Experienced with Excel, RStudio and Microsoft Power Platform products.
Experience of using Git for version control.
Confident and proactive when communicating with others.

If this role sounds like you, we invite you to apply. Thanks.

Due to work permit restrictions, we can only consider eligible applications from UK, EU citizens as well as current work-permit holders for Switzerland / Germany

It takes a team to make things happen and this team includes some of the most talented Front End Developer (JavaScript, jQuery, Angular) in the industry. FinTech is booming and our client are fast becoming a leader of this market!

All Front-End Developer positions come with the following benefits:

Shares in the company.
Pension scheme (8%).
3 hours ‚Äòfree time‚Äô each week to investigate new technologies.
An annual training allowance of CHF 4.5k.
30 days holiday (excluding Bank Holidays) plus your birthday off.
Flexible working hours.
Work from home.
Pizza and beer Fridays.
Access to free yoga classes which take place over lunch or after work in their fitness studio.




It‚Äôs an incredible opportunity so if you‚Äôre interested, act and apply today!




Location: Zurich , Switzerland / Remote Working




Salary: CHF 110,000 - CHF 130,000 + Bonus + Pension + Benefits

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
ParetoLabs is looking for a dedicated and passionate AI Engineer to join our dynamic and growing team. If you have a strong command of AI and Machine Learning methodologies, you'll play a significant role in shaping the AI-driven solutions we deliver across various industries.

About ParetoLabs

ParetoLabs is a software studio that develops customized, AI-powered applications for conversation and text processing. The startup helps customers quickly test AI applications in their context. Founded in Zurich, the "Microsoft for Startups" partner has been bringing together the most innovative AI technologies with the specific needs of Swiss companies since 2023.

Aufgaben


Analyze Customer Needs: Understand and conceptualize the solution architecture based on customer requirements.
Implement Solutions: Develop the solution architecture using Python, appropriate libraries, and Azure AI components.
Model Development: Select, train, and validate suitable machine learning models.
Integration and Quality Measurement: Integrate trained models into the solution architecture and measure their quality.
Consulting Expertise: Serve as an important point of contact for colleagues in consulting with your AI/ML expertise.
Community Involvement: Actively participate in the Data + ML community and contribute to the development of our offerings.



Qualifikation


Educational Background: Completed training or a degree in Data Science, ML, AI, Computer Science, Business Informatics, Physics, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven Experience: Practical experience in AI/ML projects.
Technical Skills: Practical experience as a developer with Python in the areas of Data Science, Machine Learning, or AI.
Advantageous Skills: Familiarity with LLMs and/or RAG systems. Experience with Azure ML and Azure AI Services. Knowledge and experience with ML Ops.



Benefits


Competitive Remuneration: A competitive salary package, reflecting your experience and contributions.
Flexible Work Arrangements: Choose from remote, on-site, or hybrid working models, with a preference for candidates based in Switzerland.
Pick Your Gear: Choose your preferred devices for work.
Attractive Benefits: above market pension benefits and a private accident insurance.
Professional Growth: Participation in the Microsoft for Startups program, offering access to valuable resources, events and support.



If you're passionate about AI Engineering and eager to make an impact on the AI application landscape, we invite you to apply to ParetoLabs. Please send your resume and portfolio showcasing your relevant experience (GitHub link preferred).

Join us in our mission to deliver cutting-edge AI solutions and shape the future of technology across industries!

Title: Full-Stack Engineer - Zurich
Description:
Who we are:

BigID is an innovative tech startup that focuses on solutions for data security, compliance, privacy, and governance. We're leading the market in all things data: helping our customers reduce risk, drive business innovation, achieve compliance, build customer trust, make better decisions, and get more value from their data.

We are building a global team passionate about innovation and next-gen technology. BigID has been recognized for:


BigID Named Hot Company in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at the 2024 Global InfoSec Awards
Citizens JMP Cyber 66 List of Hottest Privately Held Cybersecurity Companies
CRN 100 list named BIgID as one of the 20 Coolest Identity Access Management And Data Protection Companies Of 2024 (2 years running)
DUNS 100 Best Tech Companies to Work For in 2024
Top 3 Big Data and AI Vendors to Watch' in the 2023 BigDATAwire Readers and Editors Choice Awards.


At BigID, our team is the foundation of our success. Join a people-centric culture that is fast-paced and rewarding: you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented people in the industry who value innovation, diversity, integrity, and collaboration.

Who we seek:

We‚Äôre looking for a software engineer with a ‚Äúcan do anything‚Äù spirit. Working on cross product features and enhancing product resources. As a software engineer you will play a key role in developing core solutions, building new services, implementing new technologies from scratch and bringing innovation to the team‚Äôs developments. Our ideal candidate is a customer facing team player who has hands-on Backend experience and is capable of claiming ownership of a feature, from one end to another.

What you‚Äôll do:


Design logical solutions to complex challenges for our customers and internal developers
Write high-quality code, covered by solid unit and integration tests
Drive technological and architectural decisions
Review the design and code for other team members
Work directly with customers on features


What you‚Äôll bring:


At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Backend development: Node.js, Java with a Proven track record of designing and implementing software solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Deep understanding of REST APIs, Databases, message queues, multi-tenancy, big data and scalable computing.
Experience with microservices (preferably in kubernetes environments)
Experience in Agile development
A can-do-attitude


Advantages:


Java and Spring knowledge
Full stack capabilities
Familiarity with SDK and shared clients practices


What‚Äôs in it for you?!

Our people are the foundation of our success, and we place a high priority on offering a wide range of benefits that make our team happier and healthier.


Equity participation - everyone shares in our success
Flexible work arrangements
Other compulsory benefits based on country of residence


Our Values:

We look for people who embody our values - Care, Do, Try & Shine.


Care - We care about our customers and each other
Do - We do what it takes to make a positive impact
Try - We try our best and we don‚Äôt give up
Shine - We shine and make it our mission to always stand out


BigDiversity: We‚Äôre committed to creating a culture of inclusion, diversity, and equality ‚Äì across race, gender, sexuality, disability, and neurodiversity ‚Äì where innovation and growth thrive, every voice is heard, and everybody belongs. Learn more about us here.

CPRA Employee Privacy Notice: CA

BigID is an E-Verify Participant.

Title: Solutions Engineer
Description:
Saviynt is an identity authority platform built to power and protect the world at work. In a world of digital transformation, where organizations are faced with increasing cyber risk but cannot afford defensive measures to slow down progress, Saviynt‚Äôs Enterprise Identity Cloud gives customers unparalleled visibility, control and intelligence to better defend against threats while empowering users with right-time, right-level access to the digital technologies and tools they need to do their best work.

The Senior Solutions Engineer is a member of the Saviynt Sales organization, responsible for collaborating with the Sales Directors and Regional VPs to sell an integrated suite of Access Governance and Cloud Security solutions to new and existing accounts. This individual will have a broad understanding of vendor solutions, industry best practices, and technology integration, demonstrating expertise and delivery of functional and technical solutions to sophisticated customer engagements.

This individual will also provide expert knowledge to existing and prospective customers through conducting detailed technical discovery, responses to Request for Proposals (RFPs), and delivery of Proof of Concepts (POCs). Besides, this individual will be a contributor to Product Marketing collaborating in the development of white papers, solutions briefs, webinars, and blogs. The Senior Solutions Engineer will work proactively, and independently with various facets of the business ultimately driving opportunities to closure and possibility impacting revenue.

The Senior Solutions Engineer will be expected to mentor/coach Solutions Engineers on strategy, influencing the customer, managing scope, and execution of technical presentations.

What You Will Be Doing


Develop and deliver technical presentations to demonstrate enterprise solutions, ease-of-configuration, simplicity of architecture, and intelligence of workflows providing the opportunity for customer interaction and demonstrating excellent presentation skills.
Effectively communicate solution value to the business and technical audiences that is clear and satisfies prospective customer requirements and/or inquiries.
Provide needs assessment, consultation, technical solutions, and customer support with a team of Saviynt professionals.
Collaborate with both the sales and global bid team members to respond to satisfy prospective customer inquiries resulting from an RFx.
Assist members of the global bid team and collaborate with members of the product management team in the curation of RFx responses.
Effectively communicate with sales directors and sales management, working proactively and independently to prioritize and manage top regional opportunities, driving them to closure.
Regularly provide solution feedback and competitive intel from the field to Saviynt product management, solutions strategy, and marketing teams.
Ramp and coach Solutions Engineers on solution demonstration, RFP responses and presentations, technical overviews, POC scope management, and execution.
Up to 60% domestic travel post COVID


What You Bring


Peer collaboration
Domain expertise - Privileged Access Management, Identity Governance and Administration, Application GRC, and/or, Cloud Security
Exemplary communication and relationship skills
Strong business and technical document creation skills
Technical knowledge and aptitude
Exceptional listening skills
Ability to influence others
Presentation and group facilitation
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Customer responsiveness
Positive attitude


Saviynt is an amazing place to work. We are a high-growth, Platform as a Service company focused on Identity Authority to power and protect the world at work. You will experience tremendous growth and learning opportunities through challenging yet rewarding work which directly impacts our customers, all within a welcoming and positive work environment. If you're resilient and enjoy working in a dynamic environment you belong with us!

Saviynt is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Python Developer (Basel)
Description:
On behalf of our Pharmaceutical client in Basel, we are looking for a Python Developer with at least 5 years of experience.

This role requires good skills in software development and team working.

The perfect candidate:

Strong Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices.
REST API Design: Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs.
CI/CD and DevOps: Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services is advantageous.
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces is a plus.
High-Performance Computing: Prior experience working in HPC environments is beneficial.


General Information:

* Start date: 15.8.2024
* Planned duration: 6 months
* Extension (in case of limitation): possible
* Workplace: Basel
* Workload: 100%
* Remote/Home Office:partial


Tasks & Responsibilities:

* Provide agile software development services for the "Target Evaluator" project according to the project plan
* Provide technical consulting services to support the project team


Must Haves:

* Educational background: Bachelor or higher education
* Professional background in a similar role: around 5 years experience
* IT skills: Python, CI/CD, REST API design, ML engineering
* Language skills: English fluent


Nice to Have:

* ML engineering
* experience in high performance computing
* user interface design

If this job interests you please do send us your CV today through the link in the advert. However, should you have any questions please contact Elaine Kanwar at +41 61 282 22 23

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
VF Corporation is looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join our Data Science team based in Stabio, Switzerland.




Let‚Äôs talk about the role!




As a Data Scientist at VF Corporation, you‚Äôll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. You‚Äôll work on challenging problems, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and drive data-driven decision-making for all the functions and brands of VF Corporation.




We expect that you will deliver unbeatable results whilst fulfilling the following aspects of the Data Scientist role:




Develop predicting models in the area of DTC marketing.
Develop models in the area of supply and demand chain.
Monitor and maintain the already deployed models to ensure that the performances remain outstanding.
Present the results to our internal stakeholders.
Have a continuous dialogue with Data Engineers and DevOps to drive new development in the area of model productionalization.




Skills For Success

A successful Data Scientist will be able to bring his contribution in the whole Data Science development chain.




Starting from capturing the right request from the business stakeholders, talking with Data Engineers to retrieve the right data, developing the best model, and presenting the results to the Data Science management and to stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Python Proficiency: demonstrated ability to write efficient, clean Python code for data manipulation, analysis, and modeling.
Data Science and Machine Learning: strong understanding of core ML concepts (clustering, classification, regression, dimensionality reduction).
Time Series Forecasting: extensive experience with time series forecasting methods (statistical, ML, and DL).
Deep Learning and Generative AI: knowledge of main neural network topologies for computer vision and natural language modeling (CNNs, RNNs, autoencoders, transformers, LLMs, diffusion models, RAG, etc.).
Hyperparameter Optimization: Familiarity with best practices (e.g., Bayesian optimization).
Statistical Analysis: Solid grasp of hypothesis testing, A/B testing, and statistical modeling.
Querying and DBs: Deep knowledge of SQL; familiarity with other languages is a plus.
Nice to have: knowledge of recommender systems.




Tools and Platforms:

Version Control: Proficiency with Git for version control and collaboration.
AWS Ecosystem: Experience with AWS services (e.g., Sagemaker, Redshift, Bedrock) is a plus.
Data Visualization: Familiarity with PowerBI or Tableau for presenting project results.




Soft Skills:

Adaptability: Ability to react swiftly to changes and adapt to evolving requirements.
Self-Organization: Strong organizational skills to manage tasks effectively and meet deadlines.
Teamwork: Positive, proactive attitude toward collaboration.
Communication: Fluency in English. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Experience: Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in a similar role.
Experience in retail will be considered as a plus.




VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It‚Äôs the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com




What‚Äôs In It For You

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.




A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks




This post is eligible for relocation support.




Free to Be, Inclusion & Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.




As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.




If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Title: Software Engineer - Internship (100%)
Description:
Company Description

floatz envisages a world where every single person feels inspired to create extraordinary things. This fuels our mission to drive the scientific record's next evolutionary phase. By reshaping the searching and publishing of scientific knowledge, we can unlock the potential in each researcher to contribute ground-breaking discoveries.

¬†

Role Description

We are looking for a Software Engineer Intern who is obsessed with building infrastructures that improve the way people use products. This is a unique opportunity to work on an industry-disruptive AI product that shows traction and has a loyal user-base.

¬†

Personal Attributes

Is driven by building extraordinary things, not just getting things done
Excellent team player with a positive attitude, ready to collaborate and support others
Strong communication skills
Eager to bond with the team through team-building activities and social events outside of work hours
Enthusiastic about working in a small team and wearing multiple hats
Strong alignment with our company values of trust, respect, and mutual support
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically about your work
Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines
A proactive learner, open to feedback and eager to grow in a fast-paced startup environment

¬†

Qualifications

Experience with Javascript, Python, Typescript, Node.js, SQL
Solid knowledge of C++ or Rust
Solid knowledge and experience using data structures and algorithms
Familiarity with server deployment, scaling, and monitoring in cloud environments (ideally Azure)
Knowledge of best security practices
Bonus: (1) worked on AI-based products, (2) worked with front-end engineers

¬†

Internship

Paid, 6 months, full-time, hybrid, Z√ºrich (Switzerland)

¬†

BEWARE

Joining floatz is not just a career move - it's a plunge into the unknown. The path of a startup is a tightrope walk above a landscape of scarce resources. In our world, flexibility is your best skill, and change is the only constant. Be prepared to juggle roles, navigate through the chaos of long hours, and meet the challenge head-on. It's within this storm that you will grow, make a lasting impact, and create extraordinary.

¬†

If you think you bleed floatz, we await to turn your passion into your legacy.

HTML:
Company Description

floatz envisages a world where every single person feels inspired to create extraordinary things. This fuels our mission to drive the scientific record's next evolutionary phase. By reshaping the searching and publishing of scientific knowledge, we can unlock the potential in each researcher to contribute ground-breaking discoveries.

 

Role Description

We are looking for a Software Engineer Intern who is obsessed with building infrastructures that improve the way people use products. This is a unique opportunity to work on an industry-disruptive AI product that shows traction and has a loyal user-base.

 

Personal Attributes

  • Is driven by building extraordinary things, not just getting things done
  • Excellent team player with a positive attitude, ready to collaborate and support others
  • Strong communication skills
  • Eager to bond with the team through team-building activities and social events outside of work hours
  • Enthusiastic about working in a small team and wearing multiple hats
  • Strong alignment with our company values of trust, respect, and mutual support
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically about your work
  • Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects simultaneously, and meet deadlines
  • A proactive learner, open to feedback and eager to grow in a fast-paced startup environment

 

Qualifications

  • Experience with Javascript, Python, Typescript, Node.js, SQL
  • Solid knowledge of C++ or Rust
  • Solid knowledge and experience using data structures and algorithms
  • Familiarity with server deployment, scaling, and monitoring in cloud environments (ideally Azure)
  • Knowledge of best security practices
  • Bonus: (1) worked on AI-based products, (2) worked with front-end engineers

 

Internship

Paid, 6 months, full-time, hybrid, Z√ºrich (Switzerland)

 

BEWARE

Joining floatz is not just a career move - it's a plunge into the unknown. The path of a startup is a tightrope walk above a landscape of scarce resources. In our world, flexibility is your best skill, and change is the only constant. Be prepared to juggle roles, navigate through the chaos of long hours, and meet the challenge head-on. It's within this storm that you will grow, make a lasting impact, and create extraordinary.

 

If you think you bleed floatz, we await to turn your passion into your legacy.

Title: Associate Scientist
Description:
Job title‚ÄØ- Associate Scientist (70322)

Location‚ÄØ‚Äì Geneva, Switzerland

Job model‚ÄØ‚Äì On site

We Are Looking For a Highly Driven And Motivated

Associate Scientist

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world‚Äôs growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than ‚Ç¨12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life‚Ñ¢ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.

At‚ÄØdsm-firmenich, being a force for good is not optional. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion is a shared responsibility woven‚ÄØinto our‚ÄØdaily work to‚ÄØnot‚ÄØonly benefit our People, Customers & Communities but also drive business value.‚ÄØEqual access to opportunities is a given, belonging is a shared feeling, authenticity is celebrated.‚ÄØ

As a successful applicant, you will join our Science and Research Analytical Sciences Group in Geneva. You will be involved in all practical and organizational aspects of a research laboratory dedicated to the development of new analytical methods and strategies, from sample preparation to data processing, with a focus on Naturals and Tonality Excellence.

Key Responsibilities


Apply state-of-the-art analytical methodologies and explore new technologies to address questions related to the authenticity of ingredients, mostly for Flavors & Fragances.
Independently plan, prioritize and execute experiments based on instructions provided by the Scientist in charge, aiming to build solid knowledge and answer prominent questions.
Deliver reliable results on time, on scope and with fit-for-purpose quality.
Manage the technical aspects of scientific projects, with the ability to take initiatives and propose alternative approaches.
Identify technical issues and actively propose solutions.
Report work progress in a laboratory notebook, technical reports and during project review meetings.
Participate to the maintenance of the laboratory and the instruments.
Actively contribute to the global safety, health and environment protection in the team and beyond.


We Bring


Being part of an interdisciplinary team of industry-leading researchers with state of the art equipped research facility.
A diversity of exciting projects related to foods and fragranced products
Career development opportunities.
To be part of a company shaping a strong legacy through breakthrough industrial innovations and technology.


You Bring


M.Sc. in Chemistry or Food Science, B.Sc. with at least 5 years of experience, or CFC with at least 10 years of professional experience, preferably in the Flavors & Fragrances industry.
Solid practical and theoretical background in Analytical Chemistry (sample preparation and separation science, GCMS, LCMS) and ideally in Food science.
Creativity, open-mindedness, team spirit and problem solver attitude.
Experience and theoretical background in statistics and advanced data processing is an asset.
Experience in fields such as volatiles and non-volatiles quantification/identification, and curiosity for natural raw materials (authenticity, manufacturing processes) would be a plus
Good knowledge of English (oral and written) is mandatory.


The Application Process

Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume (English or French) via our career portal.

Equal Opportunities Commitment

dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate, there‚Äôs a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.

dsm-firmenich is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. dsm-firmenich people are as diverse as our customers. For us that includes a commitment to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.

About Dsm-firmenich

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world‚Äôs growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than ‚Ç¨12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life‚Ñ¢ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.

www.dsm-firmenich.com

Agency Statement

Please note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency‚Äôs fees, percentages or similar.

  • Independently plan, prioritize and execute experiments based on instructions provided by the Scientist in charge, aiming to build solid knowledge and answer prominent questions.
  • Deliver reliable results on time, on scope and with fit-for-purpose quality.
  • Manage the technical aspects of scientific projects, with the ability to take initiatives and propose alternative approaches.
  • Identify technical issues and actively propose solutions.
  • Report work progress in a laboratory notebook, technical reports and during project review meetings.
  • Participate to the maintenance of the laboratory and the instruments.
  • Actively contribute to the global safety, health and environment protection in the team and beyond.

We Bring

  • Being part of an interdisciplinary team of industry-leading researchers with state of the art equipped research facility.
  • A diversity of exciting projects related to foods and fragranced products
  • Career development opportunities.
  • To be part of a company shaping a strong legacy through breakthrough industrial innovations and technology.

You Bring

  • M.Sc. in Chemistry or Food Science, B.Sc. with at least 5 years of experience, or CFC with at least 10 years of professional experience, preferably in the Flavors & Fragrances industry.
  • Solid practical and theoretical background in Analytical Chemistry (sample preparation and separation science, GCMS, LCMS) and ideally in Food science.
  • Creativity, open-mindedness, team spirit and problem solver attitude.
  • Experience and theoretical background in statistics and advanced data processing is an asset.
  • Experience in fields such as volatiles and non-volatiles quantification/identification, and curiosity for natural raw materials (authenticity, manufacturing processes) would be a plus
  • Good knowledge of English (oral and written) is mandatory.

The Application Process

Interested in this position? Please apply on-line by uploading your resume (English or French) via our career portal.

Equal Opportunities Commitment

dsm-firmenich is fully dedicated to inclusion because when people feel engaged and empowered, their creativity and innovation drives unprecedented progress. We aim to build a workplace where opportunity really is equal, so everyone can thrive. We do not discriminate, there‚Äôs a place for everyone at dsm-firmenich.

dsm-firmenich is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. dsm-firmenich people are as diverse as our customers. For us that includes a commitment to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

We are committed to providing reasonable support for disabled applicants in our recruiting process. Should you need assistance, and are comfortable to share this, please let us know.

About Dsm-firmenich

As innovators in nutrition, health, and beauty, dsm-firmenich reinvents, manufactures, and combines vital nutrients, flavors, and fragrances for the world‚Äôs growing population to thrive. With our comprehensive range of solutions, with natural and renewable ingredients and renowned science and technology capabilities, we work to create what is essential for life, desirable for consumers, and more sustainable for the planet. dsm-firmenich is a Swiss-Dutch company, listed on the Euronext Amsterdam, with operations in almost 60 countries and revenues of more than ‚Ç¨12 billion. With a diverse, worldwide team of nearly 30,000 employees, we bring progress to life‚Ñ¢ every day, everywhere, for billions of people.

www.dsm-firmenich.com

Agency Statement

Please note this is a direct search led by dsm-firmenich. We only accept applications from candidates, not from agencies nor subject to agency‚Äôs fees, percentages or similar.

Title: Algorithm Engineer
Description:
The Mullings Group is partnered with a pioneering and rapidly growing MedTech company based in Bern, Switzerland, driving development of a next-generation surgical robotic platform.




With significant advancements in their R&D, we are currently seeking a talented Algorithm Engineer to join their team. This individual with be critical in the development and advancement of algorithms primarily for their medical imaging solutions.




Responsibilities:




Design, develop, and optimize algorithms for medical image processing, analysis and enhancement in CT, X-ray, and MR modalities.
Provide technical support and collaborate with the software development team to ensure seamless integration of algorithms into our medical imaging software products.
Evaluate and validate algorithm performance through testing, benchmarking, and analysis using medical imaging datasets.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in medical imaging, AI, and machine learning, and incorporate them into algorithm development.




Qualifications:




Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, or a related field.
Significant experience in developing medical image algorithms.
Strong background in medical imaging, computer vision, and machine learning algorithms.
Proficiency with medical imaging modalities, including CT, X-ray, and MR.
Hands-on experience with applying AI and machine learning technologies in the field of medical imaging.

Title: Trainee Meteorology & Data Science (f/m/d)
Description:
Workload: 100%

Are you interested in a challenging work environment and curious to get started in the evolving energy industry? ‚ö° Do you want to explore and learn how meteorology and climate shape the energy markets?

Become part of the Axpo Trainee community! Collaborate with various divisions and gain exciting and in-depth insights into the world of energy. You work in three different teams and build up your network among the whole group.

The perfect start for your future career as meteorologist! üíØ The traineeship begins on 1st of October 2024 and is limited to 18 months with the option of a permanent position.

What you will do:


Work on different operational and/or strategic tasks in your assignments
Take on responsibility for ongoing projects from day one
Support the meteorology desk üå¶ in your first assignment with the daily forecasting tasks by compiling and analysing meteorological data for operational reports, with a particular interest in dynamics that are critical to your stakeholders.
Develop projects to bring insightful quantifications and visualisations on the weather and climate evolution to drive decision-making in different areas of the company ‚òÄ.
Perform data analysis with reanalysis data and numerical weather model data in order to improve medium to extended range forecasting capabilities of the meteorology desk of Axpo Solutions
Utilize programming languages such as Python analyse meteorological data and build operational forecasting tools.
Assist in identifying patterns and trends in the data relevant to energy forecasting
Your second assignment will take place in our Office in Oslo, Norway üåé , and the third one is up to our interests.



What you bring & who you are:


Master‚Äôs degree in a Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, or related field (no more than 2 years of post-graduation professional experience).
Good understanding of atmospheric dynamics, knowledge of scientific literature about subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) predictability is a plus
Strong interest in meteorology and its applications in the energy markets.
Strong coding skills in either Python, R or Matlab machine learning methods for weather data analysis
Experience in analyzing meteorological datasets, such as reanalysis data, satellite data or numerical weather prediction model data
Experience in hydrology / hydrological modelling is a plus
First work experience as an intern or student employee
great communication skills and high degree of initiative and flexibility
fluency in English, German and further languages are a plus



About the team:

You will become part of the 16th trainee generation, which you will meet regularly for events. Profit from our internal learning platforms, courses, and other opportunities to shape your skills and get to know new people.

The Meteorology team at Axpo is fast moving and innovative, trying to convey probabilistic and statistical views on the future weather developments in Europe and the rest of the World. We collaborate broadly with many groups within the company and carry Axpo‚Äôs exposure to weather on multiple facets of our operations.

You will work in the office in Baden, have the opportunity to work flexible from home and benefit from attractive employee conditions.

Title: Full-Stack Engineer - Zurich
Description:
Who we are:

BigID is an innovative tech startup that focuses on solutions for data security, compliance, privacy, and governance. We're leading the market in all things data: helping our customers reduce risk, drive business innovation, achieve compliance, build customer trust, make better decisions, and get more value from their data.

We are building a global team passionate about innovation and next-gen technology. BigID has been recognized for:


BigID Named Hot Company in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning at the 2024 Global InfoSec Awards
Citizens JMP Cyber 66 List of Hottest Privately Held Cybersecurity Companies
CRN 100 list named BIgID as one of the 20 Coolest Identity Access Management And Data Protection Companies Of 2024 (2 years running)
DUNS 100 Best Tech Companies to Work For in 2024
Top 3 Big Data and AI Vendors to Watch' in the 2023 BigDATAwire Readers and Editors Choice Awards.


At BigID, our team is the foundation of our success. Join a people-centric culture that is fast-paced and rewarding: you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work with some of the most talented people in the industry who value innovation, diversity, integrity, and collaboration.

Who we seek:

We‚Äôre looking for a software engineer with a ‚Äúcan do anything‚Äù spirit. Working on cross product features and enhancing product resources. As a software engineer you will play a key role in developing core solutions, building new services, implementing new technologies from scratch and bringing innovation to the team‚Äôs developments. Our ideal candidate is a customer facing team player who has hands-on Backend experience and is capable of claiming ownership of a feature, from one end to another.

What you‚Äôll do:


Design logical solutions to complex challenges for our customers and internal developers
Write high-quality code, covered by solid unit and integration tests
Drive technological and architectural decisions
Review the design and code for other team members
Work directly with customers on features


What you‚Äôll bring:


At least 3 years of hands-on experience in Backend development: Node.js, Java with a Proven track record of designing and implementing software solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Deep understanding of REST APIs, Databases, message queues, multi-tenancy, big data and scalable computing.
Experience with microservices (preferably in kubernetes environments)
Experience in Agile development
A can-do-attitude


Advantages:


Java and Spring knowledge
Full stack capabilities
Familiarity with SDK and shared clients practices


What‚Äôs in it for you?!

Our people are the foundation of our success, and we place a high priority on offering a wide range of benefits that make our team happier and healthier.


Equity participation - everyone shares in our success
Flexible work arrangements
Other compulsory benefits based on country of residence


Our Values:

We look for people who embody our values - Care, Do, Try & Shine.


Care - We care about our customers and each other
Do - We do what it takes to make a positive impact
Try - We try our best and we don‚Äôt give up
Shine - We shine and make it our mission to always stand out


BigDiversity: We‚Äôre committed to creating a culture of inclusion, diversity, and equality ‚Äì across race, gender, sexuality, disability, and neurodiversity ‚Äì where innovation and growth thrive, every voice is heard, and everybody belongs. Learn more about us here.

CPRA Employee Privacy Notice: CA

BigID is an E-Verify Participant.

Title: Solutions Engineer
Description:
Saviynt is an identity authority platform built to power and protect the world at work. In a world of digital transformation, where organizations are faced with increasing cyber risk but cannot afford defensive measures to slow down progress, Saviynt‚Äôs Enterprise Identity Cloud gives customers unparalleled visibility, control and intelligence to better defend against threats while empowering users with right-time, right-level access to the digital technologies and tools they need to do their best work.

The Senior Solutions Engineer is a member of the Saviynt Sales organization, responsible for collaborating with the Sales Directors and Regional VPs to sell an integrated suite of Access Governance and Cloud Security solutions to new and existing accounts. This individual will have a broad understanding of vendor solutions, industry best practices, and technology integration, demonstrating expertise and delivery of functional and technical solutions to sophisticated customer engagements.

This individual will also provide expert knowledge to existing and prospective customers through conducting detailed technical discovery, responses to Request for Proposals (RFPs), and delivery of Proof of Concepts (POCs). Besides, this individual will be a contributor to Product Marketing collaborating in the development of white papers, solutions briefs, webinars, and blogs. The Senior Solutions Engineer will work proactively, and independently with various facets of the business ultimately driving opportunities to closure and possibility impacting revenue.

The Senior Solutions Engineer will be expected to mentor/coach Solutions Engineers on strategy, influencing the customer, managing scope, and execution of technical presentations.

What You Will Be Doing


Develop and deliver technical presentations to demonstrate enterprise solutions, ease-of-configuration, simplicity of architecture, and intelligence of workflows providing the opportunity for customer interaction and demonstrating excellent presentation skills.
Effectively communicate solution value to the business and technical audiences that is clear and satisfies prospective customer requirements and/or inquiries.
Provide needs assessment, consultation, technical solutions, and customer support with a team of Saviynt professionals.
Collaborate with both the sales and global bid team members to respond to satisfy prospective customer inquiries resulting from an RFx.
Assist members of the global bid team and collaborate with members of the product management team in the curation of RFx responses.
Effectively communicate with sales directors and sales management, working proactively and independently to prioritize and manage top regional opportunities, driving them to closure.
Regularly provide solution feedback and competitive intel from the field to Saviynt product management, solutions strategy, and marketing teams.
Ramp and coach Solutions Engineers on solution demonstration, RFP responses and presentations, technical overviews, POC scope management, and execution.
Up to 60% domestic travel post COVID


What You Bring


Peer collaboration
Domain expertise - Privileged Access Management, Identity Governance and Administration, Application GRC, and/or, Cloud Security
Exemplary communication and relationship skills
Strong business and technical document creation skills
Technical knowledge and aptitude
Exceptional listening skills
Ability to influence others
Presentation and group facilitation
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Customer responsiveness
Positive attitude


Saviynt is an amazing place to work. We are a high-growth, Platform as a Service company focused on Identity Authority to power and protect the world at work. You will experience tremendous growth and learning opportunities through challenging yet rewarding work which directly impacts our customers, all within a welcoming and positive work environment. If you're resilient and enjoy working in a dynamic environment you belong with us!

Saviynt is an equal opportunity employer and we welcome everyone to our team. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Our client is a ML focused consultancy who are looking for a talented ML Engineer to join their innovative team. They partner with start-ups and scale-ups to build initial AI components, as well as assisting larger companies in developing their comprehensive ML capabilities. Why Join the team?




‚Ä¢ üåç Location: Basel office with hybrid working flexibility ‚Ä¢

üöÄ Start Date: August/September




Role Highlights:

‚Ä¢ üí° Innovate: Identify and capitalize on new business and product opportunities

Title: Python Developer (Basel)
Description:
On behalf of our Pharmaceutical client in Basel, we are looking for a Python Developer with at least 5 years of experience.

This role requires good skills in software development and team working.

The perfect candidate:

Strong Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python, with a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices.
REST API Design: Deep knowledge and experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs.
CI/CD and DevOps: Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment using GitLab, GitOps, and Kubernetes for hosting services is advantageous.
Familiarity with implementing user interfaces is a plus.
High-Performance Computing: Prior experience working in HPC environments is beneficial.


General Information:

* Start date: 15.8.2024
* Planned duration: 6 months
* Extension (in case of limitation): possible
* Workplace: Basel
* Workload: 100%
* Remote/Home Office:partial


Tasks & Responsibilities:

* Provide agile software development services for the "Target Evaluator" project according to the project plan
* Provide technical consulting services to support the project team


Must Haves:

* Educational background: Bachelor or higher education
* Professional background in a similar role: around 5 years experience
* IT skills: Python, CI/CD, REST API design, ML engineering
* Language skills: English fluent


Nice to Have:

* ML engineering
* experience in high performance computing
* user interface design

If this job interests you please do send us your CV today through the link in the advert. However, should you have any questions please contact Elaine Kanwar at +41 61 282 22 23

Title: Algorithm Engineer
Description:
The Mullings Group is partnered with a pioneering and rapidly growing MedTech company based in Bern, Switzerland, driving development of a next-generation surgical robotic platform.




With significant advancements in their R&D, we are currently seeking a talented Algorithm Engineer to join their team. This individual with be critical in the development and advancement of algorithms primarily for their medical imaging solutions.




Responsibilities:




Design, develop, and optimize algorithms for medical image processing, analysis and enhancement in CT, X-ray, and MR modalities.
Provide technical support and collaborate with the software development team to ensure seamless integration of algorithms into our medical imaging software products.
Evaluate and validate algorithm performance through testing, benchmarking, and analysis using medical imaging datasets.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in medical imaging, AI, and machine learning, and incorporate them into algorithm development.




Qualifications:




Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering, or a related field.
Significant experience in developing medical image algorithms.
Strong background in medical imaging, computer vision, and machine learning algorithms.
Proficiency with medical imaging modalities, including CT, X-ray, and MR.
Hands-on experience with applying AI and machine learning technologies in the field of medical imaging.

Title: Trainee Meteorology & Data Science (f/m/d)
Description:
Workload: 100%

Are you interested in a challenging work environment and curious to get started in the evolving energy industry? ‚ö° Do you want to explore and learn how meteorology and climate shape the energy markets?

Become part of the Axpo Trainee community! Collaborate with various divisions and gain exciting and in-depth insights into the world of energy. You work in three different teams and build up your network among the whole group.

The perfect start for your future career as meteorologist! üíØ The traineeship begins on 1st of October 2024 and is limited to 18 months with the option of a permanent position.

What you will do:


Work on different operational and/or strategic tasks in your assignments
Take on responsibility for ongoing projects from day one
Support the meteorology desk üå¶ in your first assignment with the daily forecasting tasks by compiling and analysing meteorological data for operational reports, with a particular interest in dynamics that are critical to your stakeholders.
Develop projects to bring insightful quantifications and visualisations on the weather and climate evolution to drive decision-making in different areas of the company ‚òÄ.
Perform data analysis with reanalysis data and numerical weather model data in order to improve medium to extended range forecasting capabilities of the meteorology desk of Axpo Solutions
Utilize programming languages such as Python analyse meteorological data and build operational forecasting tools.
Assist in identifying patterns and trends in the data relevant to energy forecasting
Your second assignment will take place in our Office in Oslo, Norway üåé , and the third one is up to our interests.



What you bring & who you are:


Master‚Äôs degree in a Meteorology, Atmospheric Science, or related field (no more than 2 years of post-graduation professional experience).
Good understanding of atmospheric dynamics, knowledge of scientific literature about subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) predictability is a plus
Strong interest in meteorology and its applications in the energy markets.
Strong coding skills in either Python, R or Matlab machine learning methods for weather data analysis
Experience in analyzing meteorological datasets, such as reanalysis data, satellite data or numerical weather prediction model data
Experience in hydrology / hydrological modelling is a plus
First work experience as an intern or student employee
great communication skills and high degree of initiative and flexibility
fluency in English, German and further languages are a plus



About the team:

You will become part of the 16th trainee generation, which you will meet regularly for events. Profit from our internal learning platforms, courses, and other opportunities to shape your skills and get to know new people.

The Meteorology team at Axpo is fast moving and innovative, trying to convey probabilistic and statistical views on the future weather developments in Europe and the rest of the World. We collaborate broadly with many groups within the company and carry Axpo‚Äôs exposure to weather on multiple facets of our operations.

You will work in the office in Baden, have the opportunity to work flexible from home and benefit from attractive employee conditions.

Title: Graduate in Data Science (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?

If so, you are at the right place!

Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.

About The Program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.

Join us if you are interested in work experience in Data Science.

What can you expect?


As a Nexi graduate, you will be offered a permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment. This will ensure you feel confident, knowing your future role.
During the 12-month program, you will participate in two rotations between different business departments. This will equip you with a broader understanding of the business from various perspectives.
After the first six months, we offer a well-planned Project Management and Communication training path. You and your fellow graduates will work on real Nexi business cases.
You will have the opportunity to continuously learn and improve your skills by actively participating in structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
You will be able to develop your business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.


What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?


You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM, Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2024.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.


Apply Now!

Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!

We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.

We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

Title: Frontend Engineer (all genders)
Description:
Dein Wirkungsfeld


Als Frontend Engineer arbeitest Du in einem agilen Umfeld und entwickelst gemeinsam mit Deinem Team unsere Methodik kontinuierlich weiter.
Gemeinsam mit Expert*innen aus anderen Fachbereichen entwickelst du benutzerfreundliche, performante und ansprechende Weboberfl√§chen mit Fokus auf E-Commerce und Marketing (CMS)

Du interagierst mit diversen Backend-Systemen wie SAP Commerce und Pimcore.



Was Dich auszeichnet


Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung in der Frontend-Entwicklung mit, vorzugsweise im Bereich E-Commerce.
Du hast idealerweise eine Ausbildung in Informatik, Mediamatik oder Design absolviert

Du sprichst flie√üend Deutsch und Englisch.

Ein leidenschaftliches‚ÄØDigital-Business-Team mit Tatendrang und Initiativkraft, das sich gegenseitig unterst√ºtzt.
Moderne Arbeitsumgebungen mit Wohlf√ºhlfaktor (Standorte‚ÄØSt. Gallen,‚ÄØZ√ºrich‚ÄØund‚ÄØDornbirn).
Weiterentwicklungsm√∂glichkeiten, die zu dir passen.
